name.value: An Ideal Necklace: A Victorian Gabbing and Gifting Game

item.description:
Victorian Ladies are on the hunt for fashion and husbands, each seeking to achieve her own personal ambition in An Ideal Necklace, a quick-moving game for one to four players.

Social engineering or by-the-numbers logical deduction are equally valid strategies as is everything in-between. Cards are visible to all, who may talk and influence other players' actions. Alliances may be made, or broken. Each turn, a Lady may: (1) select an event or a necklace from the Store; (2) attend Charm School to gain Charm; (3) gift a necklace to another Lady to earn Favor; (4) teach another Lady Charm in return for a necklace; (5) use Favor to prevent another Lady from acting.

Events are opportunities that may be acquired in lieu of selecting a necklace and they provide special powers, like the ability to recover Discarded necklaces or to Woo a Suitor twice, acquiring him as a husband.

Ladies gift necklaces to others to earn Favor, which is used, along with Charm, to Woo a Suitor, of which there are four. Once a Suitor has been Wooed twice, a Lady acquires him as a husband and if she has also achieved her Ambition, she earns bonus points and ends the game. Ambitions are goals, like acquiring the most necklaces, or gaining the most Favor.

Points are earned for: achieving an Ambition, ending the game, capturing a husband, possessing Charm, and for owning necklaces--some of which are especially valuable! The Advanced variation, also included, adds Suitor Traits, which vary Suitors' point values and which add special abilities.

Throughout, each player gabs and gifts their way to success, wooing Lords and giving necklaces to each other, attempting to attain An Ideal Necklace and An Ideal Husband as each Lady quests for An Ideal Victorian Life.

Ciak! is a card game where several pictures companies fight for the dominance of Lollywood, recruiting actors, crew members, all-time-legends in order to "pillage" other companies and eliminate them from the game, by making then loose all their "dominance" points.

Classical LCG mechanics are reimplemented in this new setting, and several game modes are available: team game, free for all, one against all.

The game is played in turns, divided in phases:

 Phase 1: the active player draws a card from the pile and gains 1 million.
 Phase 2: the active player recruits from his/her hand actors, crew members, all-time-legends, paying their cost in millions, when present. Other players can use "istant speed" abilities and cards.
 Phase 3: The active player chooses an opponent to attack him/her. After performing a successfull attack roll, the attacking player sums all the attack values of his/her recruited cards, while the defending player adds his/her defence values. Istant speed abilities and cards can be used to modify such results. If the attacking player wins, he/she performs a pillage action: the defending player will loose one o more dominance points. If the defending player wins, he/she can damage one of the attacking payer's recruited cards.
 Phase 4: same as Phase 2. At the end of this phase, all damage and activeted abilities are cleared off.




A company which looses its last dominance points is eliminated from the game.

Mamma Raptor has escaped from her run and laid her eggs in the park. A team of scientists must neutralize her and capture the baby raptors before they run wild into the forest.

Raptor is a card driven boardgame with tactical play and some double guessing. Players use their cards to move their pawns (scientists on one side, Mother and baby raptors on the other) on the board. Every round, the player who played the lowest ranked card can use the corresponding action, while his opponent has movement / attack points equal to the difference between the two cards values. The scientists can use fire, can move by jeep on the tracks, and can even call for reinforcements, while the mamma raptor can hide in the bushes, yell to frighten the scientists, and call for her babies.

item.description:
Tinker Tailor is a role-picking and set-gathering card game for 3 to 6 players suitable either as a general family game or as a light 'filler' game. The aim of the game is to get the most points.

Points are collected in the form of money cards or goods cards, and the more goods cards a player owns (up to a maximum of eight) of a given type, the greater the value of the cards. Players also get a bonus for collecting all five goods: Bread, Fish, Cloth, Wine and Gems.

Each turn, each player selects one role that defines the action they can take. The players who make the best choices and uses their actions to the greatest advantage will win the game.

name.value: The Manhattan Project 2: Minutes to Midnight
El Proyecto Manhattan 2: Minutos para la Medianoche

item.description:
20 years after the end of The Manhattan Project, the superpowers of the world are embroiled in another vicious arms race. Manufacturing nukes is no longer an obstacle; all nations are now capable of churning them out at a rapid pace. The challenge of this era lies in the development of various delivery systems called the "Nuclear Triad:" strategic bombers, ballistic subs, and land-based ballistic missiles.

Each player represents one of the superpowers in the arms race. At staged intervals, scoring is conducted in one of 4 categories:

- Strategic Bombers
- Ballistic Submarines
- ICBMs
- Short-range missiles deployed to third world nations

In addition to earning points for deploying nukes during the scoring rounds, players can also earn defensive bonuses for mitigating the risks imposed against them.

The game ends after all of the scoring events have been completed. The player with the most points is the winner.

To help along the way, you will recruit 4 different kinds of workers:

- Laborers, which operate your buildings
- Spies, which operate your opponents' buildings for your gain
- Politicians, which produce tax revenue and gain control over third world nations
- Generals, which deploy your bombers, subs, and overseas missiles

You will also construct and operate 6 different kinds of buildings:

- Factories, which produce submarines and aircraft
- Research Facilities, which allow you to improve your position in 5 different technology tracks
- Reactors, which produce nukes
- Silos, which are armed with ICBMs
- Test Sites, which allow you to detonate nukes in your own territory for points
- ABM Launchers, which earn defensive bonuses against various threats

Minutes to Midnight is a standalone game. It is part of The Manhattan Project line from Minion Games.

item.description: The National Network Game is played on a wooden board printed with a 5x5 grid. Each player has five pawns of the same colour. The game starts with a row of pawns in alternating colours on opposite sides of the board. name.value: Fateful Days: The Marne Campaign of 1914

item.description:
This is the third game in the TPS of the Pocket_Battle_Games from LPS, Inc.
It covers the Marne Campaign of 1914. One player is the German and other play with the Entente (French and British troops).
German Player wins if there is a German unit in or adjacent to Paris at end of any turn and he can trace a line of connected squares, free of Entente units. Otherwise, the Entente players win.
Counters need to be cut from around the edge of the card. Die-cut counters are available from Turning Point Simulations with any purchase at no additional charge.

The world's most powerful criminal organisations have come together in a struggle for control of a rich and corrupt city. Hire Goons, make alliances, and hit the right Bosses to install a new Kingpin and win this game of strategy.
Hiring Goons gives you more cards to use.
Making alliances with Bosses lets you use their Ally Powers (many powerful combinations are possible!).
Putting out a hit on a Boss gives you points (unless it is from the same family as the Kingpin.)
At the end of the game, each player gets 1 point for each Goon they control, 2 points for each Ally they have made, and Bosses they have hit are worth points equal to their hit number (unless they are from the kingpin's family). Most points wins.

chibiMob is a modular game. The base game includes 6 modules;
(Yakuza, Mafia, Triads, Posse, Jewish Mob, and Russian Mob)
Include more modules for more players or to increase game length. Use fewer modules for a quicker game or fewer players.
1 module : 2 players 10 minutes
2 modules : 2-3 players 20 minutes
3 modules : 2-4 players 30 minutes
4 modules : 2-5 players 40 minutes
5 modules : 3-6 players 50 minutes
6 modules : 3-6 players 60 minutes

name.value: The Little Big Game of Moocho Sudooko

item.description: The Big Little Game of Moocho Sudooko turns sudoku puzzles into a board game. The board is a 9x9 square divided into 9 grids of 9. Each player gets 27 tiles (3 sets with the digits 1 to 9) in one of four colours. At the beginning of each turn the player rolls the dice and uses the result to decide which tile to play. A tile can be placed in any spot as long as there are not two identical numbers in the same row, column, or grid square. If the player cannot make a legal move, or the player does not play before the timer runs out, play passes to the next player. Play continues until there are no legal plays that can be made. (Alternatively, players may shift (but not remove) tiles to allow further plays.) The player with the fewest remaining tiles is the winner. In case of a tie, the numbers on the remaining tiles are added and the player with the lowest total wins.

Promotional game for "Individ Kohle" (brown coal briquettes) from the 1930s. The game can be played as a simple roll-and-move-game with event spaces, that hinder or benefit the player, or as a Pachisi variant (Heraus mit ihm!).

In this game, the children learn countries, capitals, flags and continents in an enjoyable game, while enriching their knowledge and memory skills!

Similar to matching pairs memory game.

Contents: 27 country cards & 27 city cards

Italy during the 15th century was a country full of intrigue and magnificence. The tumultuous political conditions created the perfect breeding ground for the birth of a new form of government (called Signoria) and the rise of the most ambitious noble families. After having acted in the dark for a long time, the time has finally come for them to take control of the cities and shape Italy’s future. Their stories will go down in history.

In Signorie, you will play the role of a Signore, a Lord of one of the most prestigious families of the Renaissance. One at the time, players choose one die from a common pool. (Twenty dice in five colors are rolled at the beginning of each round.) You place it on your player board (your city) and perform one of the possible actions. The color of the chosen die determines the action, and the number on the die is a discount on the cost of the action.

During a round, each player can perform up to four actions. At the end of the round, if the sum of a player's chosen dice is equal or lower than 13, he can obtain a reward.

The dice mechanism is easy and innovative and gives players a simple, but challenging choice. Money is always tight, so there is a temptation to choose a high valued dice, but that needs to be balanced with obtaining the reward.

item.description:
The aim in Ninja Dojo Fight! is to prove you're the best Ninja by participating in unsanctioned battles. To help you win, you must break into the dojo and look for the best weapon you can find at the break of dawn. The game is made up of five rounds with each round consisting of three turns followed by a battle phase. Each turn has three phases:


 Select: Each player secretly chooses an action.
 Reveal: All players simultaneously reveal their chosen action.
 Resolve: Actions are resolved in ascending order.


After three turns, a battle occurs and a new round begins. The player to win the most battles after five rounds is declared the winner. In the event of a tie, the players tied play one additional round, called the showdown; whoever wins the showdown wins the game.

---

Ninja Dojo Fight! is a micro game inspired by Entropy. You play as a ninja from one of four rival disciplines. As a ninja in training on your final test, your goal is to win the most battles using the weapons at your disposal.

The game play has similarly to the main counterpart Entropy, through the use of simultaneous action selection, but it's not quite the same game. With only 42 cards, it is more thematically and technically accessible than Entropy. The visual design is minimalistic and the cards do not have any text.

item.description:
Basra is a fishing standard deck playing card game similar to Casino. The game plays with 2, 3 or 4 players. 4-player game are usually played in partnerships.

Each player is dealt four cards and four cards are played to the table making the "floor". Jacks and 7's of diamond from the floor are shuffled back into the deck and replaced. Players take turns playing one card to the floor and capturing cards if possible. When each player has played all four cards, the dealer deals out four more to each player, unless the deck is empty in which case the round is scored.

Captures can be made by playing a card of the same rank or a card that sums to two or more cards. Multiple captures are possible, for example a 10 would capture a 3, 7 and 10 from the floor. Queens and Kings do not have numerical value so the only way to capture them is by playing the same rank or a special card.

Players earn a Basra, worth 10 points, by capturing all the cards remaining on the floor . Players keep track of this by keeping the capturing card face up in their point pile. Jacks capture all cards on the floor, but do not count as a Basra. Jacks played on an empty floor capture nothing and remain on the floor. The seven of diamonds plays just like a jack except it earns a Basra if the captured cards add up to 10 or less. After the last card is played, remaining cards on the floor go to the player who made the last capture.

Scoring
The player (or team in partnerships) with the most cards receives 30 points. Ties are pushed to the next round (so 60 points could be earned).
Jacks and aces are worth 1 point. 
The two of clubs is worth 2 points.
The ten of diamonds is worth 3 points.
Basra's are worth 10 points each.

A new hand is dealt unless someone has a total score of 101 in which case the player with the highest score wins. In case of a tie a new hand is played.

item.description:
Home Raiders is a game played with small scale models. These models represent the combatants that travel from a dimension known as the Inner-space to your very home, in order to battle for the dominance of your space. These fighters are little folk (which means that the scale of the models is actually 1:1) which exist in dimensions parallel to ours, and crash our world in order to thrive in theirs.

The basic game is very easy to grasp, and is a great option for a fast game that takes place in your actual living room coffee table, your office desk, or even around your kitchen sink. It takes no time at all to set up, so you can get your dice rolling in a breeze. If you are an experienced gamer, Home Raiders is a great choice for an improvised gaming session or even a well laid out match amongst a bunch of friends. If you want to play with your younger brothers and sisters, cousins or even your children, you won't find a better option to getting them started with this amazing hobby.

The Road is a post-apocalyptic survival card game set in the zombie-infested Australian outback.

It is a 3-5- player game which explores the social-dynamics of balancing group welfare against self-interest. You need to help each other in order to survive, but at the end of the day you must make ruthless decisions about who lives and dies.

As the name suggests, you are travelling down a road through the outback, attempting to reach the airfield which is your hope of escape. The game proceeds in a series of "days". Each day you choose the next location to explore, fight some zombies and scavenge for useful items. Each night you must decide who you can trust to stand guard while the others sleep.

As the days wear on, hunger and tiredness build, supplies run short, and you face a difficult decision: whether to remain loyal to the group, to run, or to turn on your fellow players (before they turn on you).

The Archmage is dying... a successor must be found from the 4 schools of magic, so a contest is afoot. The Principal of the school with the most Prestige will be the next Archmage.

Each player controls 10 wizards of one of the 4 different schools (on the base game they would be fire, earth, water & air). In the beginning players start with 4 wizards and add more to their ranks as the game progresses.

Each turn players will have to choose different locations on the board that suits their strategies from gathering resources, to recuiting wizards & heroes, going into quests, creating potions and spells they can use later, and fighting in the terrible DARK TOWER.

Since this game is euro styled, all of this elements are somewhat abstract, so in order to go into a quest you place a wizard on one of the adventure cards and if you pay the resources needed and have all the requirements for the quest to be successful you win the card and any reward that is given.

Heroes are an important part of the wizard guild as they provide extra abilities to combat and enhance how the resources are gathered. They can go up levels (up to 4) and with each level they grant more to the school they work for. Up to 2 levels can be earn in the usual tavern brawls... but the other 2 must be gain in quests or challenging the DARK TOWER.

Archimago has several elements shared by traditional Eurostyle games that use worker placement but at the same time potions and spells provide and interaction with the other players that if mastered can be of a great assistance to the School, events change game conditions, Characters can appear and add a new location to go to, etc.

The base game comes also with 1 scenario that is made of a set of cards that are mixed with the adventure cards and that when are dealt change the conditions of the game or offer sudden opportunities for the players that have the resources to risk or the desire to count on fate for better possibilities.

The game is modular so it is highly expandable in several directions that will add to the system new possibilities and the feeling of adventure, starting with new scenarios that will make each game feel different, characters that will appear in the different locations to assist the players, events that will happen when creating potions and more sudden apparitions that will contribute greatly with the atmosphere of the world.

The game ends on 1 of 4 conditions:


 The adventure cards spots cannot be filled.
 2 or 3 lines of potions/spells are depleted.
 Sometimes a Scenario Card will end the game when certain conditions are given.
 When all the Dark Tower Cards are gone.


In the end Archmage is more than an eurogame, an experience that is worth trying. Each adventure card has been carefully designed so the title leads to the story below. Beyond the abstract elements there is a story going on in the game that those players that are fan of the detail will certainly love.

Spanish description:
El Archimago esta muriendo... un sucesor debe ser encontrado de entre las 4 escuelas de magia, asi que un concurso se realizara. El Rector de la escuela con mayor Prestigio sera el siguiente Archimago.

name.value: Batman: The Joker Air Race Game

item.description:
Object: Capture the Joker. The first player to fly from Wayne Manor to the Joker's Flying Fortress wins.

Playing the Game: All players start a Wayne Manor. (green start square) The youngest player spins first and then moves his/her playing piece the number shown on the spinner. Play continues with the next player on the left. The first player to reach the Joker's Flying Fortress (red finish square) wins.

Flying: Players move in a straight line (left-right, up-down, diagonally) one direction per turn. Player may pass each other, but they cannot occupy the same space at the end of the turn. If a player lands on an occupied space, he/she must move one space less in another direction. Players CANNOT fly through buildings, they must fly OVER them.

The Spinner: The spinner is divided into six parts. The five numbered sections (2,3,4,5,6) show how many spaces a player can move during his/her turn. The Joker spinner section activates the "Plane Scrambler" forcing ALL PLAYERS to land on the building space directly below. Player resumes when the next player spins.

JOIN THE CIRCLE:
During the mid-nineteenth century, spiritualism became increasingly popular. Mediums would gather a group of believers for a séance as they attempted to contact the spirits of their dearly departed relatives. Now it’s time for you to create your own circle around the table as you attempt to contact these wispy spirits.

OBJECT OF THE GAME: 
Play cards onto the séance circle to “make contact” with Spirits – contact your spirit by matching its incantation or steal another player's spirit by spelling out the word “Séance”. Use special chain cards to "lock" incantation cards in place or scare the other players silly with game-changing "fright" cards. Collect Spirit cards for points.

CONTACTING SPIRITS
There are two ways you can contact spirits:
Capture your spirit by matching the Spirit’s incantation
Steal another player's spirit by spelling the word Séance

HOW TO WIN: The player who captures 3 spirits wins. For a more challenging game, collect 13 points of Spirit cards to win.

VARIANT PLAY
For a more challenging game, discard one Séance card from your hand to use its unique ability

S – Steal a random Séance card from any player's hand. 
é – Expel any player's Spirit from the circle and replace it with a new card from the Spirit deck.
A – Alter the circle by discarding a Séance card and replacing it with a new card from the Séance deck.
N – No - Chosen player gets one less action on their next turn.
C – Change a Seance card on the circle with another Seance card on the circle.
E – Exchange your hand with another player’s hand.

The goal is simple. Choose 1 of 4 unique characters, each with his or her own Golem companion, and beat the ever-loving bejesus out of your friends. The last player left with any bejesus being the winner!

Each character’s arsenal will include the following card types to help them achieve victory: Combat, Combo, Reflex, and Fusion cards. Most of the damage you’ll deal will be in the form of Combat and Combo cards.

item.description:
Each player chooses a Disney character He puts the character’s picture in front of him and pushes out all the pieces; eyes, gloves, pants, shoes, hat and jacket.
Players take turns to flick the Spinner round the Disney Circle. If the pointer comes to rest on a jacket, the player places the jacket on his character. If it comes to rest on a shoe, he puts one shoe on his character and so on. If the character already has the item on which the pointer has come to rest, the player doesn't score that time round. If the pointer comes to rest on a star the player may choose any one item and put it in position. The first player to complete dressing his character wins the game.

Description from the publisher:

Submarines and surface fleets battle for dominance of the seas! One team must use submarines to sneak troops into enemy ports and destroy vital strategic targets, while the other team deploys a surface fleet to hunt down the subs and protect their crucial supply lines.

Designed by retired Royal Navy Officer and submarine commander Andrew Benford, and developed deep beneath the waves, They Come Unseen is an asymmetrical strategy game of bluffing and deception that uses two boards: one for action on the surface, seen by both players, and one for movement underwater, seen only by the submarine commanders. The game also comes with specially designed control panels to aid each player in tracking vital information such as fuel, ammunition and current cruising depth.

item.description:
Join a brave party of adventurers in search of treasures and fame! Explore consecutively three dungeons filled with wandering monsters, traps and treasure, and survive to get the honor and glory.

Unlimited Adventures is a dungeon delve for 1-3 players and 20-30 minutes long, with a great deal of planning, bluffing and memory.

In Unlimited Aventures, each player takes the role of a different adventurer. You'll need to work together to survive until consecutively three dungeons, but only one of you will make it out with the enough treasure and win the game! The dungeons are different each time you play, offering new surprises as you collect treasure, trigger abilities, and fight off horrible wandering monsters!

It is a game where you have to be able to plan your incursion into the Dungeon optimally to avoid ending up dead or vilified by your opponent.

Unlimited Adventures can also be played as a solitaire game.

item.description:
The title refers to a 'level' of an alarm. Level 1 might be helping a cat down a tree but Level 6 might be a massive fire at a chemicals factory.

The board is a track of 60 spaces and, in that regard, it is a 'Goose-Type' game. Throw the die and move along the track and if you land on a space with instructions, you must obey those instructions. It has a few differences to common games of this type. Some spaces 'attract' other players' pieces to come to help you with an Alarm. This in effect means that other people will be helped forward if they are behind or brought back if they are in front. First to get to space 60, wins.

The playing pieces are small metallic fire-engines.

Wild Cats is a social game for 3-6 players. Players are one of six cats riding in a police car back from an arrest. Deal out the cards randomly and follow the rules on the cards. Do whatever! Interrogate your opponents. Grill them (not literally). Maybe you'll make bold statements that coincide with your role? There is so much room for exploration, but remember to follow the rules on your card and don't look at your opponents' cards.

As the Good Cat, you need to suss out the Bad Cat and get the Wildcat to also vote for the Bad Cat. If you're the Bad Cat you want the opposite. But if you are the Wildcat, you need to get someone to vote for you, and figure out exactly who it is to create a tie.

When you are ready to vote, count to 3 and point at the player that you want out. The player with the majority of the votes is eliminated. Reveal your cards to see who won!

name.value: Random Encounter: Plains of the Troll King

item.description:
Random Encounter is a strategic, number-based, pixel-art card game for all ages. Players build encounters made up of various creatures, then try to win as many battles as possible at the table in the pursuit of loot! Each fully customizable deck is made up of basic number creature cards along with several trick creature cards to throw your opponents off guard. Two or more players compete to reach five loot before other players by either winning the most battles or stealing loot from the coffers of their fallen enemies.

The game and pixel art is being created by Jamie Keddie (creator of Jackpot! and artist on Minecraft: Console Editions) of Joyride Games who has extensive experience with both card and video games design. Random Encounter combines these things in a new, fun, package for everyone to enjoy!

The game also contains a one-player adventure mode in which the player tries to find keys so that they can open a boss room and defeat the final encounter.

item.description:
All across America trucks rumble across the interstate carrying products from manufacturers to retailers. As a small start-up company with a truck, an office and a dream you are throwing you hat into the ring to challenge the big boys. The freight has to be moved and there is competition for who can get to loads first and who can make the most profitable routes. But watch out, Smokey is on the prowl. So put the hammer down and let it all hang out. You have to get loaded up & truckin’.

As a player, you represent a small but growing trucking company seeking to pick up and deliver goods in the most efficient manner possible. Amassing money is one way to achieve victory, but there are other ways to score as well. It is important to dominate a region or two with the most deliveries while not ignoring the other regions. In the end, your deliveries will be compared to the other players to determine which company has the best overall presence in the US.

Players gain presence by moving their trucks from city to city across the United States picking up and dropping off deliveries along the way. You can specialize in high profit cross-country runs or you can make numerous short routes. On each turn the vagaries of the business will be determined by a deck of event cards. Each player will then get to buy new hubs and trucks before setting out to scoop up goods before a rival comes along and 'steals' the load.

name.value: The Little Big Game of Word Maven

item.description:
The Little Big Game of Word Maven consists of 6 letter dice, a dice cup, paper money and a sand timer. One die is a vowel die, with a e i o u and an 8-ball on the faces. Five dice have a mix of consonants, vowels and wild sides. Players roll the vowel die to determine who goes first. Each player receives starting money from the bank and a Jackpot Fund is started. 
On their turn each player rolls all 6 dice. The goal is to make the longest word possible with the letters on the face of the dice. The player may roll up to 3 times per turn, but must keep at least one die per roll. The first roll is free; money must be paid to the Jackpot Fund for each extra roll. If the 8-ball face is rolled the player's turn is immediately over. Each turn must be finished before the timer runs out.

Scoring is based on the length of the word the player makes. Longer words pay more money. The Jackpot is won when a player makes a 6 letter word without using any wild sides. The winner is the player who has the most money at the end of a predetermined time, or the player who reaches a predetermined amount of money first. Additionally, each die has an orange letter on one face that spells the word “MAVENS”. Spelling MAVENS instantly wins the game.

A 2-4 player board game that combines elements of Tower Defense and Dice Rolling to see who rules the seven seas. The name of the game is eliminating your opponents and getting the most loot as possible while in the process of taking over the Caribbean. You will sail throughout the board, discovering treasure, obtaining island defenses, and trying to survive a War on Piracy--all while avoiding the dreaded Curse of Neptune.

Each player is dealt a Pirate Captain and a Ship--which will give you a total hit point value for the game. Avoid the cannons, find the treasure, defeat your opponents.

The fortress has fallen. The battle lost. The forces are scattered. You're on the run! You can't tell who is friend or foe. Suddenly you hear a noise! Your enemy is upon you! You have to attack! But with what? You've forgotten his weakness! No matter, attack with all you have! Pray you'll go down with honor and your ancestors will be forgiving. Attack!

Samurai Rundown is a tile based player versus player game with card based battles. Players start on a tile based map and go around collecting items and weapons, and revealing map tiles. When a player thinks they have enough weapons, they go after their enemy to attack them. When they are adjacent to their enemy, they initiate a card battle. The loser of the card battle loses a heart. When a samurai loses 3 hearts they die.

Be the last samurai standing to win.

Samurai Rundown also has a showdown mode. When all the weapons are found and drawn. All samurai drop their hearts to one from being exhausted and head to the nearest temple to duel. The samurai then battle to the death. The last samurai standing here is the winner.

Be the last samurai standing.

You're the manager playing against your division rivals, selecting pitches, organizing batting lineups, and developing a winning strategy. Each at bat begins with a 3-2 count and one pitch decides the outcome of the play. Full Count Baseball features exciting scenarios, including stolen bases, double plays and pickoffs. The game features four logoed game pieces for all MLB teams. The game board resembles a real ball park with fans in the stands and dugouts. A dry-erase scoreboard and marker are also included. Instructions are simple and easy to learn for players of all ages.

41 (or Forty-One) is a traditional card game commonly played in Syria and Lebanon. It is a partnership trick-taking game, in the same family as Whist and Boston, with a substantial difference from most such games: players bid and score individually.

Bidding and play is counter-clockwise, and traditionally trumps are always Hearts. In turn, each player bids a number of tricks they expect to take. The dealer, who bids last, can potentially cause the hand to be re-dealt by the next player if the total bid score count is less than 11. Play is as in most trick-taking games: match suit if possible, otherwise trump if desired or throw off; highest card of the suit led wins, unless trump is played, in which case highest trump wins, and winner leads to the next trick.

A player scores a number of points equal to their bid if they get at least that many tricks on their own (so 3 points for bidding 3 and winning 3 or more tricks), and loses that many points if they fail to get their bid (so -3 points for bidding 3 and winning 2 or fewer tricks). A bid of 7 or above is for double stakes (14/-14 for 7, 16/-16 for 8) and guarantees that the hand is played.

The winning partnership is the first to have a player reach at least 41 with their partner's score above 0.

An electronic version of the hit party game Taboo. Get your team to say the secret word without using the unmentionable words.

Unlike its predecessor, Electronic Taboo, Taboo Buzz'd has only 1,000 taboo words instead of 2,200, it has no skill-level setting and displays only four taboo words per guess word, and it includes only one six-round game mode. The Taboo buzzer button is no longer a separate component and is built into the main unit, which now has an illuminated display.

item.description:
A dark age approaches the Realm of Atheria –- the vast ancestral lands of the Amurelden people are under siege by countless hordes of mana-infected beasts. 

While cold steel and piercing iron may help defend the Kingdoms and Empires that stretch across the sub-continent, their only real chance for surviving rests in the hands of wizards.

The passing of the Lorelias comet signalled the coming of a new era –– one marked by a relentless battle for survival.

 The sapphire colossus was last seen more than three centuries ago – it torched the skies, spilling its mana-filled insides across the entire planet. Many believed that the mystical messenger of doom would never return -- 

Some of the more ancient wizards still remembered the chaos of its last passing -- they themselves witnessed the horrors and death that unfolded in its wake -- things they had hoped never to see again. 

Wizard Survival is a card game for 2-4 players. The games mechanics were specifically designed to assure that every game is a new and unique challenge.

One of the games two modes is survival - a free-for-all match that is won by being the last surviving Wizard in the game. Players use magic spells to defend against marauding monsters, and are limited by the scarcity of resources.

The other game mode is cooperative, in which players join forces in order to vanquish the 4 powerful bosses. This mode has four difficulty levels, especially designed to push players to their limits.

Players throw the dice and moves his pawn along the board. They have a several destinations where they try to catch as the most valuable fish. Crowned the winner is the player who is at the end of the season for the most points earned catches.

item.description:
A fully cooperative survival miniatures board game. Mission-based with a highly modular game board.

Every player takes the roll of a survivor to fight against the reavers and horrifying mutants, causes through the outbreak 5 years ago.

Blood Fall: The Last Days offers a great combat system where positioning is the key to survive. You have to find Items, weapons, crafting upgrades with components to manage your character. You can learn skills to improve your chances to survive.

Beside the combat system one of the great and innovative game features is the enemy AI. Every enemy acts by itself. They have movement paths and smart combat mechanics.

The game design has finished to 90%. The artwork is about 90%. Actual focus is on mission design for great adventures.

Play Testers Voice:
"So complex, but not complicated."
"Highly cooperative. Don't split the group!"
"The best weapon system i've played with...a shotgun feels like a shotgun and a kitchen knife -puh- feels like that. Great."
"Very smart A.I. system. The routing of the enemies is great and acts as a natural timer. If you had the chance to test it. Test it!"

Shadows over Europe is a two- or three-player game simulating the diplomatic, economic and military development leading up to and eventually being unfolded in World War II.

Players assume the roles of Germany, the Soviet Union and the United Kingdom. Players attempt to outperform each nation’s historical record in the world’s most gigantic struggle. The game starts in 1935 and ends by an automatic victory or in the summer of 1945.

Shadows of Europe is played over 11 years, 1935-1945. Each year is represented by three turns; a Between Years turn (diplomacy, resource collection and research), a Winter turn (land operations), and a Summer turn (land and naval operations). Further each turn is divided into several phases.

A fundamental part of the game design is that actions rather than units are hidden from the enemy. This captures the game’s ambition to reflect a strategic rather than tactical level. In WWII the concentration of larger forces was often known to the enemy, whereas their strategic intent was not.

Units are Infantry and Mechanized/Panzer armies, Leaders, Surface raiders, U-boat flotillas, Escort Groups and Convoys. Air forces are abstracted to a combat modifier for each front.

The game facilitates two kind of resources: Minerals used for production and Oil for operations.

Rulebook and Playbook:
The 20-page rulebook is clearly written with many examples and designer notes. Also included is a 14-page playbook with extended examples of play, strategy hints and a card index.

England in the Middle Ages is seeking a King. Knights from across the land go on exciting and adventurous quests with one goal in mind: to pull the sword Excalibur from the stone and claim the throne. As in the story, the game lets players take the role of knights wandering from town to town and adventure to adventure. While doing so, they encounter the saga's heroes - bridge guardians, generous barkeeps, successful noblemen - who influence the events of the game.

As part of the “Smart Play” series, a smartphone mounted over the board keeps track of the players actions and plays the voices of friends and foes. Another difference to the original game (King Arthur) are the dice to determine the result of fights. The players can gain strength to get additional dice. The free app also explains the rules.

Manuscripts is a 3-dimensional medieval game. You lead a search party of three characters into a castle to retrieve your kingdom’s stolen manuscript. Your search party consists of a Warrior who is strong and fast, a Wizard who has three game changing magic cards, and a Princess who is responsible for retrieving her secret Manuscript that is on a face down card selected at the start of the game.

Each board you enter requires summoning a Monster that is controlled by the player on your left. You will face an Orc, Ogre, Minotaur, Werewolf, Knight of Doom, Dragon, or the Grim Reaper. item.description:
Cute old Dutch game.

Components in my edition:
2 Spoons
4 Balls
Insert that acts as the board
Rules inside lid

The game is intended for children and was designed to help children with their mathematical skills. Game 1 is for the youngest children. Game 2 is for slightly older children. Game 3 is intended for much older children, say, 8 to 10 year olds.

The board is punctuated with holes and each hole has a value next to it. The cute spoons have a long handle and a 'bowl' into which you balance a ball. Hold the spoon over the board and blow the ball off. If the ball is in a hole, do the same with the 2nd ball. If, at any time, a ball does not roll into a hole, the player may blow it again.

Game 1. Add the two numbers together after both balls are in holes. The highest total wins.

Game 2: Start with a base total of 5. Add the value of the hole where the first ball lands. Subtract the value of the hole where the 2nd ball landed. Highest total wins.

Game 3: Use all 4 balls. Again, start with a base total of 5. The first ball's value multiplies the base score. The second ball is added to the running total. The third ball is subtracted from the running total and the 4th ball is divided into the running total after the third ball has been computed. Highest total achieved, wins.

Mix It is a mix-and-match monster game, but you're not just trying to build any monster; you want to create ones that's exactly the same as the one shown on your secret goal card: same eyes, same mouth, and same legs. Unfortunately we all share the same laboratory and have space to build only two monsters at a time, so there's total chaos in the lab! Players never stop adding new parts and moving them from one monster to another. We also need to pay close attention to the monsters on the table because they change constantly and our monster can appear at any time, even on another player's turn...

item.description:
Sector 6 is an abstract strategy game for 1 to 4 players, with a playing time of 30 minutes. Each player controls two prisoners as they make their way through the winding labyrinth of a space prison, trying to collect enough oxygen to survive while denying their opponents the same. The goal is to collect as many points as possible (represented by oxygen tiles of different colors and values), located inside a maze formed by hexagonal tiles. Players must move across the maze and collect the points before their opponents.

The game has two phases: construction and competition. In the construction phase, players take turns placing tiles and creating the the board (maze). Then the competition phase begins, where players move around the maze attempting to collect more points (oxygen) than their opponents. Where players place their tiles is of utmost strategic importance in the construction phase: Sector 6´s building system allows strategic planning while the maze is being created. In the absence of a predefined configuration, each game takes place on an entirely new board. There are essentially an infinite amount of setup configurations which allows for high replay value.

But building a good maze and moving quickly will not be enough to achieve victory. During the game, Sector 6's maze will be in constant motion, as players can rotate the tiles, thereby changing the layout of the maze, potentially allowing players to block their opponents or create new pathways to reach the points faster. So it won't be the fastest player who wins, but the one who learns how to best use the intricacies of the maze to their own advantage and to the detriment of their opponents!

name.value: Father Mole Looks for the Treasure

item.description:
User summary:

Become the head of a mole household and explore for treasure in a nearby cave.

Each turn, players may either draw from the tile bag and place their spoils in the "search pile", or move the entire contents of the "search pile" to their home for safekeeping. Just be sure to watch out for ghosts tiles which cause a player to love everything they haven't stored at home.

The first player to get 10 points worth of treasure to their home wins.

The Ginger Wars is a game of battling gingerbread people. Each player has 5 character pieces in which they protect and battle others for their pieces. The first person to complete a brand new gingerbread person wins the game.

It's fast paced where you're constantly attacking and defending with your battle cards. You have to be smart and pick your opponents wisely, manage your revolving deck of cards and keep track of what others have played. You need to get your bluffing game going. Get people to waste their strength and attack them when their momentarily weak.

The Ginger Wars aims to appeal to the casual and more experienced gamers. It doesn't take long to learn the rules, but playing your opponents like a fiddle will take time.

Dinosaur Math consists of 1 double-sided game board, 4 dinosaur counters, 2 number dice and 1 operations die. Each side of the game board is a different game.

Dino Tracks: Each player chooses a dinosaur marker and places it on the same colour start space. The youngest player goes first. Both number dice are rolled and the player adds the numbers together and moves that number of spaces on the board. The first player to move their dinosaur to the home space is the winner.

Dino Stomp: Each player chooses a dinosaur marker and places it on the same colour start space, and rolls the two number dice. The highest number goes first. Players roll all 3 dice and use the numbers and operation shown to determine what number of spaces to move. Some spaces have instructions on them. The first player to reach the finish space is the winner.

Explore a fascinating world similar to that of ancient Greece, full of magic, technological development, and weird customs; in a kingdom mired in court intrigue, seductive women and sword fights; a world of a bloody revolution in which your ancestry no longer matters. It is all about survival and spilling blood in the struggle for the throne in the kingdom of Troy.

Achaia is a tactical game with only one goal: Become the ruler of Troy. Each player represents a noble house, and you try to survive at all costs by use of all kinds of manipulation and foul play. But beware, you will need to avoid the scheming of your envious, vicious and relentless enemies...

item.description:
A children's game that teaches about the development of life on earth. Players spin the spinner and move their dinosaur-shaped pawn that number of spaces, which correspond to different species. They progress from micro-organisms through plants to invertebrates and then vertebrates, each time doing ocean life and then land life. There are numerous squares that make you go back 2 if you land on them, and the last 5 spaces must be landed on by exact count, all giving a catch-up mechanism.

The back of the board has family trees for the plant and animal kingdoms, and charts showing forms of life appearing during different epochs of earth history.

Paths to Hell (PTH) (Volume III) is a stand-alone game in the War Storms series (WSS). Recreates the events of those days and allows the players to reproduce the most famous battles of the Blitzkrieg on the East Front at a tactical level. Players take command of either the Allied or Axis forces (or can play solitaire) in the tactical battles of each scenario.

PTH while utilizing "La Bataille de France, 1940" base rules, incorporates new and adapted rules and additions for this new front. The WSS promises many hours of fierce fighting between the infantry, tanks, artillery and aircraft belonging to the armies enveloped in this conflict. Just a few of the additions include:


 Human wave attacks
 Battalion officers
 Communist Commissars
 Recon rules
 Flamethrower tanks
 Motorcycle recon
 Waffen SS
 Rumnanian
 Gully
 Rail Roads
 One 8'5 x 11" chart with many overlays


PTH has a moderate complexity with good solitaire suitability. The system emphasizes the role of officers. Officers can activate units, coordinate with other officers and their units, call for artillery support, air support, smoke screens, influence moral checks, coordinate assaults, and much more. Rules for special actions.

Based on the principle of simultaneous execution, or simply "WE GO", a hybrid system of turns and "real time". The players must activate unit leaders to perform many actions (fire, assault, move, coordinate, etc). A turn ends when both players have completed all their activations. The scale is platoon level with units

representing groups of between 30 and 40 soldiers, weapons units represents groups of 3-4 weapons and their accompanying crews (20-25 soldiers), and the AFvs-Transports representing groups of 3 to 5 vehicles and their corresponding crews. Scenarios are divided into turns representing about 12-15 minutes of action.

Turns are divided into the following phases: Command Phase, Initiative Phase, Activation Phase and Marker Removal Phase

The game uses isomorphic mapboards, each of which are aligned to any edge of equal length on any other mopboard. This allows for an almost unlimited number of combinations to create any terrain situation, including player designed scenarios. Each map hex represents a distance of approximately 150 to 200 metres.

Components

 4 Isomorphic Maps
 8 Overlays
 5 sheets of Counters (3 of 5/8” and 2 of 3/4”)
 1 Standard Rulebook
 1 Exclusive Rulebook
 7 Scenario Cards featuring 13 scenarios 
 3 Charts and Table Cards
 2 Battalion Charts Cards
 2 six-side dice

link.value: Alone in the Storm: Solo Play Expansion for War Storm Series
Normandy: The Beginning of the End

item.description: The first player to get his 2 pawns from space 1 to space 100 wins the game. Movement is determined by 1 or 2 dies. If a pawn lands on a space with the number 10 or a multiple of 10, its next roll counts double. A pawn that gets on a space with a square number automatically advances by as much spaces as the numbers square root. Spaces with prime numbers can only be left by rolling a prime number.

Game Election is a simple and intuitive card game to help a group of 3-6 players decide which game to play in a fun and fair manner.

The 54 card deck is comprised of six different sets of nine cards (YEA, DOUBLE YEAH, NAY, and VETO), and four of the cards have special powers such Cancel a Vote and Break Ties. But the powers have consequences: swap another player's cast vote and they get to chose your color/faction in the winning game!

Gameplay is fast: players nominate up to 8 games and then place their votes in a face-down pile in front of the game. They may then use their one remaining card's special power... if they choose.

Costume Party is a quick card game about bluffing, memory, and looking great. The goal is to score the most points among several rounds of play by wearing certain costumes.

Each round, players have a hand of three cards and can play one of five corny costumes -- Vampire, Mummy, Robot, Ghost, Zombie, or one half of a Horse costume -- and each costume works a little differently. For example, you win 6 points if you and another player can coordinate a Horse costume... but lose 3 points if you go as just a Horse's bottom.

Welcome to the complex world of plants. A place where thriving depends on strategy, tactics and maybe a tiny bit of luck .

Plants compete to be the most successful wild plant. Players will be deciding how to use their resources to best support their plants'
success in this game's environment. Conflict of Plants at its core is both an action selection and an area control game, but with a twist. The environment does not always favor the most abundant species.

The game consists of 6 rounds. Each round excluding the first, the player with the fewest points swaps two on-map Non-White Tokens with those of the randomly-chosen icons. Each player, in turn order, sends their cubes to tiles have an icon that matches the icon played to their Player mat. Players then in turn perform one action each three times.

Each player then places one Brown Token onto an empty corner of a tile in the map again matching an icon to what was played on their Player Mat. The map is then examined in order to award points and Brown Tokens. The players then balance each region by removing cubes from each tile until the number of Player Cubes in total is equal to or less than the region’s number.

Finally, the players clean up their Player Mats to prepare for the next round.

In The Last Spike, players must cooperate to build a continuous railway from St. Louis to Sacramento. Different routes are possible and some towns never get a railway link. Each player competes to accumulate the most money from land speculation before the "last spike" is laid.

Each player has a hand of four track tiles, with each tile showing a particular location on the game board and a cost. The game board depicts nine cities in a diamond shape, with St. Louis at one tip and Sacramento at the other, and locations where track can be built are marked on the game board.

On a turn, a player places one of their track tiles in the appropriate space, paying the cost while doing so. (If a player can't afford to place track, they must sell one or more of their train deeds to raise cash.) If the player is the first to place adjacent to a city, they gain a deed to that city for free. After placing a tile, a player can purchase one deed for a city.

Whenever two cities are connected, all holders of the deeds for those two cities receive funds from the bank based on the number of deeds they hold. A city will pay out 0-4 times depending on where it is and how track is built during the game.

When a player places a tile that creates a contiguous track from St. Louis to Sacramento, this player receives a $20,000 bonus, everyone receives a deed payout for the cities just connected, then the game ends. Whoever has the most cash wins.

item.description:
In the seventeenth century, the Caribbean, was an area little explored and full of adventure, where the intrepid crews traded and discovered valuable treasures.

Choose your crew, your cargo and weapons, and sailing in the Caribbean, seeking fame and riches.

In 1653: Sailors and Merchants, you will use your ship , which is represented by a deck of cards (which you will change during the game) in order to get the most possible fame points.


En el Siglo XVII, el Caribe, era un área poco explorada y llena de aventuras, donde las tripulaciones intrépidas comerciaban y descubrían valiosos tesoros.

Elige tu tripulación, tu carga y tus armas, y navega el Caribe en busca de fama y riquezas.

En "1653: Marineros y Mercaderes", usarás tu barco, que es representado por un mazo de cartas (que irá cambiando a lo largo de la partida) para conseguir la mayor cantidad de puntos de fama.

SiXeS is about things that are similar and different. Play six rounds, thinking of six things each round and trying to predict what you will write that will match — or not match — what the other players write, depending on whether you are in a "match" round or a "unique" round. The player with the most points after six rounds wins.

SiXeS is #6 in the E•G•G Series from Eagle-Gryphon Games.

Harrie has eaten all your stuff. Try to pick them one by one out of his mouth. He's asleep. Watch out! Don't wake him, he'll grab your hand!

Is the object you grabbed colored? Well done! Did you grab an insect or a black object? Ouch! You have to put the item back into Harrie's mouth and you lose one of your collected items.

When Harrie bites while your hand is in his mouth, you lose 2 of your collected items.

The first player to collect 5 items, wins the game.

There is a special scoring system for older children.

From the publisher:

Play Classic Connect 4 - and MORE! There are 3 NEW Connect 4 games: Backwards Connect 4, Connect 4 Any Color and Connect 4 Teams! Contains 40 Heavy Duty cardboard tiles (20 red and 20 yellow) and illustrated instructions for 6 different games!

The darkness spread all around the chamber with the quiet howling in the background. There was a spectral sensation in the room, dark and ominous. Don’t get spooked though and sit around the mystic board in a vain hope to catch the spirit... Before it will manage to catch you.
 Third Eye is the truly terrifying hybrid card game of cutthroat decisions, quick wit and brutal interactions. Be the last one to survive a haunting from beyond and never hesitate to lead the malignant presence towards other, unfortunate souls!

A spoken party game in which players try to guess the object on the card using closed questions (that can only be answered 'Yes', 'No', or 'Maybe'). If players fail to guess correctly within 20 questions the answerer wins.

Based on the BBC Radio panel game show (which was itself based on a US radio show derived from a 19th century parlour game) the package contains twelve object cards with enough information to answer most questions.

Death Wish is a light-hearted party card game where the goal is to be the first player to die from fictional diseases. Truly a game you're dying to win.

Players take turns to collect matching symptoms and afflicters with the aim of contracting the diseases displayed on the table. Diseases are always changing on the table so it’s a race before they’re snapped up by other players. The colours play a part in the game with white strains the most common, less harmful types contrasted with the rare and deadly reds.

Share your weird diagnosis! Contract a disease and declare the the disease you caught, how you caught it and the terrible combination of symptoms you are suffering from. With over 240 different diseases, afflicters and symptoms, the combinations are vast.

Does your disease have an outbreak? Read out an outbreak card to the group. Outbreaks allow events such as mutating diseases, puking on players or even de-fibrillating someone back to life. These cards have an array of random creative effects that change the dynamic of every game.

item.description:
Res Publica returns with a new version under a different theme. In Res Publica: 2230AD, the players travel to the future, when races migrate through space searching for new areas in which to settle. Intensive trading brings together strong Races, encourages new settlements and promotes the development of civilization.

Each turn is divided in three different phases: Trade, Display and Draw cards. Each player at his turn can make a trade offer and each player in turn responds in kind. Using the cards through trading and drawing players work to acquire five identical race cards in order to build a Space Station (which increases the number of cards you can draw each turn) or five identical technology cards in order to build a City (which gives Victory Points). A variant play has been created in this game where each player, owns a planet divided in four different missions. If a mission is accomplished, more Victory Points are added to the sum and if a player completes all missions game ends.

Aside the set collection and trading mechanisms, you will discover some extra cards in the game. New buildings with different abilities that either allow you to build a City displaying four technology cards, or give you extra Victory Points. At the end of the game, players total the points collected and the highest score wins.

name.value: A Conta da Copa é Nossa!

item.description:
A Conta da Copa é Nossa! is a card game who pictures the process of building the infrastructure of Brazil's 2014 World Cup.

Each player represents a contractor which competes with other players to gain more profit and participation in the constructions. To achieve their goals, the players will have at their disposal a humorous deck of illustrated cards with politicians and characters which can help you with many tasks: gain favors, spoil the adversaries, work around difficult situations, among other things.

At the beginning, each player gets 20 cards of characters. Three piles are stocked at the center of the table: constructions, governors, and sponsors. After that, 8 construction cards, 1 governor and 2 sponsors are removed from their piles, and the players can use them, replacing the cards as they are used. There are material tokens that make constructions possible. They are obtained by using the characters and politicians cards.

Each construction sums points to a total, and the highest total wins the game.

Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man has brand new mechanics for Allies and Underdogs. Even when the odds are against Spider-Man, he’ll surprise you with some new tricks!

item.description:
Shoot Your Friends is a lightning-fast game that pits opponents across from each other with nothing but a toy gun and a deck of cards between them. Be the first to create a lethal combination of cards on the table to become either the shooter or the shootie. To play Shoot Your Friends, you must have fast reflexes, quick thinking, and an itchy trigger finger.

Separate the 6 Bullet Cards from the deck and set them aside. Deal 8 cards to each player. Each player places 4 cards face down, side by side, on the table and his other 4 cards (the player’s hand) face down off to the side. Players may not look at them… yet.

Place the rest of the cards into draw piles on the table within easy reach of every player.

Use Character Cards to create matches and use the toy gun to shoot your friends out of the game.

Use Shield Cards to deflect bullets and stay alive a little while longer.

Use Bullet Cards to determine who wins!

item.description:
In the near-distant future, after years of war and famine, a global pandemic kills most of the world’s population. Those that survive are transformed by the virus, unlocking a latent genetic code. Now, the world is ruled by the three original species of planet earth: Vampires, Werewolves and super Humans.

BANE is a three-suited competitive card game, where the suits represent powerful races (humans, vampires and werewolves), each hunting another, locked in a conflict for dominance. The Order of Prey (who hunts who) is similar to rock-paper-scissors:

 Humans hunt Werewolves
 Werewolves hunt Vampires
 Vampires hunt Humans




Cards are played to a board in what is called an engagement. Similar to a trick-taking game, once all players put a card into play one winner is determined using the Order of Prey (described above). Cards also have a ranking, called Speed. Unlike other trick-taking games (such as Spades) a player may not play a card whose speed matches that of a card already in play - thus allowing players to 'speed block' other players. There are eight speeds, represented by numbers in the upper-left corner of each card.

Example: After all cards are played during an engagement, Bob sees that his Pack Alpha (Werewolf, Speed 1) is the fastest. He will thus be able to take a trophy from another player, as long as there is a Vampire in play (because Werewolves hunt Vampires).

Taking a trophy means that the player may choose from a pool of face-down cards in front of another player.

The round (Hunt) ends when one player is out of cards or trophies. At that time, the deck is shuffled and a new Hunt (round) begins.

WINNING THE GAME:
Each player tracks their individual score. A Player wins by reaching the MASTERY space on the score track and having more trophies than opponents also in the MASTERY space.

There are other elements to the game that add flavor (Special Power cards, a BANE token).

item.description:
Monster Buffet is a real-time, extremely fast paced, quick party game! Every players play a monster with endless hunger whose only purpose in life is to gorge itself full. Mostly on smaller, much less fortunate little critters! But alas, he is not the only one with empty belly and gaping maw. Other hungry monsters want their share too, and gosh, they are greedy!

Each player grabs the token with one hand and puts it in his monster belly. Building and eating stack of critters, from one up to ten. You can take the lower number, same number or higher number, but never skip one in between! At the end of each round the app counts the points. The stack is worth the number of points equal to "meat" icon collected in it. In each round all players draw a random mutagen card. Each card offers them a task to fulfill to get extra points. Dare to get a run at them to tip the victory in your favor!

name.value: Marignan 1515: la chevauchée de François 1er en Italie
Marignan 1515: the ride of Francis I in Italy

item.description:
Marignan 1515: la chevauchée de François Ier en Italie (Marignan 1515: the ride of Francis I in Italy) is the new opus of the “Gold & Steel” series started with Les guerres de Bourgogne (Wars of Burgundy).

This is an historical simulation of the 5th War of Italy - July 1515 to February 1517 – featuring Marignano battle: a French victory that shapes the relationships with the Swiss confederacy for centuries in ending their supremacy on battlefields and will reach this year its 500th anniversary

One player leads the French armies and their allies (Republics of Venetia and Genoa and the other one is in command of the Swiss Confederacy and its allies – the Holly League - (Papal states, Duchy of Milano, Holly Roman Empire, Kingdom of Naples). The goal of both of them is to take control of the Duchy of Milano and Venetian territories hold by the Empire, win pitched battles or major sieges, and neutralise the opponent's allies.

One key element of the game is collecting enough resource each turn (the gold) to pay all the mercenaries troops (the steel); German landsknechts and Swiss soldiers. Otherwise they will quit the battlefield… The money can be used to neutralize enemy allies as well.

This is both a strategic & tactical game with armies and garrisons evolving on the main strategic map representing Northern and Middle Italy and units fighting on a tactical map featuring a typical XVIth century battleground. Units are men-at-arms, pikemen, crossbowmen, halberdiers, harquebusiers, swords & bucklers, jinetes and stradiots (both light cavalrymen) pioneers, cannons, from 1,500 to 2,000 men at full strength, 750 to 1,000 horsemen or 100 cannons of all calibres. The specifics fighting elements of that period are added with tactical chits (rolling shots, infantry or cavalry charges, harassment, ditch, fence, clash of pikes, feint, hedgehog, cannon battery, etc.), arms combination – early Tercios - and events such as rain, snow, minor ally no fight or betrayal, no wing deployment, no money no mercenaries, Alle Freunde (all friends). Optional rule includes a hidden crossing of the Alps Mountains.

The complete sequence of a turn:
I/ Kingdom of France
1) Reinforcement, replacement
2) Strategic move
3) Attrition phase
4) Combat phase (battles & sieges)
II/ Holy League
Same sequence
III/ Diplomatic phase
Check for victory
